radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver shows normal signal and morphology with fatty deposition in the hepatic parenchyma. A 0.7 cm enhancing lesion in the caudate lobe likely representing focal nodular hyperplasia. Multiple gallstones in the gallbladder with a 1.3 cm stone in the neck, slight distention of the gallbladder, small pericholecystic fluid, and marked hyperemia in the adjacent hepatic parenchyma. A tiny 4 mm focal nodule in the gallbladder wall consistent with a polyp. Normal pancreas, spleen, and kidneys. No abdominal or retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy and unremarkable bowel.
